meanings.definition: To sell (something) before it is officially available for purchase.
meanings.sent1: The company started preselling their new product to loyal customers.
meanings.sent2: Many online businesses use preselling strategies to boost sales.
meanings.sent3: The preselling of concert tickets caused excitement among fans.
meanings.sent4: His ability to presell items made him a successful entrepreneur.
meanings.sent5: Preselling allows businesses to gauge customer interest before production.

meanings.definition: The act of promoting or generating interest in a product or service before it is released.
meanings.sent1: Preselling can help create buzz around a new product launch.
meanings.sent2: The preselling of limited edition items often leads to high demand.
meanings.sent3: The preselling event drew a large crowd eager to be the first to purchase.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for preselling made her a valuable asset to the marketing team.
meanings.sent5: The preselling campaign was a huge success, exceeding sales expectations.
